title._content: Global Feminisms - Opening this Friday - March 23, 2007

tag.raw: elizabeth a. sackler center for feminist art
tag.author: 83979593@N00

description._content: We've got a ton of events for the opening weekend of the Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art. Everything from Members Previews, ribbon cuttings, book signings, and talks and performances. Check out the full schedule here. www.brooklynmuseum.org/eascfa/events/index.php In addition, we are thrilled to announce that in conjunction with the exhibition Global Feminisms, feminist artists from more than fifty countries are discussing or performing their works. Talks and performances take place every half-hour in the Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art—the full schedule can be found here. www.brooklynmuseum.org/global_feminisms_schedule.php Judy Chicago will be joining us to sign books on Thursday, March 22, from 2 to 3 p.m., during special preview hours. (Members will be admitted from 12 to 5 p.m.) She will also sign books from 6:45 to 7:45 p.m., during the opening celebration. www.brooklynmuseum.org/eascfa Have you seen Global Feminisms? Speak your mind and comment here: www.brooklynmuseum.org/community/comment/exhibition.php?id=1
